result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah J Kropp

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Noah J Kropp in court with attorney Jessica Shank Phelps.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is dismissed.

2:41 p.m.  Defendant Noah J Kropp in court with attorney Jessica Shank Phelps.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Phelps requests that the witnesses not be present in the courtroom.  Jason Parks is sworn as witness and testifies to the facts.  Testifies to the tip he received on 3/9/15.  Testifies to investigating the tip with the defendant.  Cross examination by Atty. Phelps.  Re-direct from Atty. Zell.  
2:59 p.m.  Officer Jason T. Foemmel is sworn as witness by Atty. Phelps  Testifies to the facts.  Testifies to what rules he knew regarding school student rules.  Testifies to speading with the defendant at the school.  Cross examination by Atty. Zell.  Re-direct Attorney Phelps. 3:09 p.m.  Atty. Phelps argues her motion.   Court denies the motion

ADDRESS INFO for Noah J Kropp
Current: 2107 W Marathon St, Marshfield, WI 54449 United States  (Effective: 11-10-2015)
Prior: 309A S Cedar Ave, Marshfield, WI 54449 United States

1:08 Defendant Noah J Kropp in court with attorney Jessica Shank Phelps.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Phelps asks that bond be amended to incidental contact with minor females so that Kropp can attend school.  Atty Zell makes a clarification and does not object as long as it is clear that it is incidental in the school building.  Court modifies the bond.
No contact with REH or residence or any incidental contact with minor females. Incidental contact w/minor females inside school building only.

Bond amended to allow supervised contact with other minor female family members and BG
No contact with REH or residence or any incidental contact with minor females.  No contact with Marshfield High School.
No contact with females under age 18 except incidental contact at school. No contact with Marshfield High School.

1:38 Defendant Noah J Kropp in court with attorney Emily M. Nolan-Plutchak.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.
